name: Linguine with Clam Sauce and Baby Portobello Mushrooms
author: MOUNTAINRIDER
summary: This is one of my all-time favorite meals. What makes the clam sauce so flavorful is the chicken bouillon, Worcestershire sauce, and baby portobello mushrooms. I recommend having this with some garlic bread and a nice glass of red wine. A very satisfying meal.
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package baby portobello mushrooms, sliced and chopped
4 (6.5 ounce) cans chopped clams with juice
directions: Warm olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat
Stir in garlic and mushrooms; cook until mushrooms are tender
Stir in clam juice, chicken bouillon, parsley, basil, oregano, and Worcestershire sauce
Increase heat to high, and bring to a quick boil
Reduce heat to medium; simmer 30 minutes
Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta, and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes
Stir chopped clams and butter into the sauce; simmer 15 minutes more
Pour over cooked pasta to serve
